intro: Eupatorium conzattii, commonly known as Conzatti's thoroughwort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in wetlands and along stream banks, preferring moist, sandy soils. Its leaves are usually opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and clustered in dense, spherical heads. Eupatorium conzattii is often found in swampy habitats and is an important component of wetland ecosystems.
